==Platform==
==Platform==
{{main|Google platform}}
{{main|Google platform}}
â
Google runs its services on several [[server farm]]s, each comprising thousands of low-cost commodity computers running stripped-down versions of [[Linux]]. While the company divulges no details of its hardware, a 2006 estimate cites 450,000 servers, "racked up in clusters at data centers around the world."<ref name="howgoogleworks">Carr, David F. "[http://www.baselinemag.com/c/a/Projects-Networks-and-Storage/How-Google-Works-%5B1%5D/ How Google Works]." ''[http://www.baselinemag.com/ Baseline Magazine].'' 6 July 2006. Retrieved on 7 February 2008.</ref>
+
Google runs its services on several [[server farm]]s, each comprising thousands of low-cost commodity computers running stripped-down versions of [[Linux]]. While the company divulges no details of its hardware, a 2006 estimate cites 450,000 servers, ''"racked up in clusters at data centers around the world."''<ref name="howgoogleworks">Carr, David F. "[http://www.baselinemag.com/c/a/Projects-Networks-and-Storage/How-Google-Works-%5B1%5D/ How Google Works]." ''[http://www.baselinemag.com/ Baseline Magazine].'' 6 July 2006.
